	format=flowed;
	delsp=yes
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I will answer my own question for the next person that runs into this  
pro=
blem.

I figured out why the Heritrix crawler was running at one page per  =

second.
It was configured it to run using a default Java VM size of 256m

=
cat /etc/init.d/heritrix.sh
#!/bin/bash

/opt/heritrix/bin/heritrix --bind=
=3Dyowb3 --admin=3Dadmin:admin

I changed this to 2048m and it seems to be =
running 10x faster

cat /etc/init.d/heritrix.sh
#!/bin/bash
export  JAVA_OP=
TS=3D" -Xmx2048m"

/opt/heritrix/bin/heritrix --bind=3Dyowb3 --admin=3Dadmi=
n:admin

-----------------

Rates
9.55 URIs/sec (16.1 avg)
246 KB/sec (389 =
avg)

Load
6 active of 50 threads
1 congestion ratio


On Jan 2, 2010, at 9=
:59 AM, depappas wrote:

ces connected to a  
> single switch.
>

internet link connected to the  
> switch is 10% of the max bandwidth (90% =
of the bandwidth is unused).
>

w.
>
